author: COMSOL
description: This example uses the Newtonian (first- and second-order), Lagrangian, and Hamiltonian formulations to compute the trajectory of a charged particle in a uniform magnetic field. This benchmark computes the Larmor radius and compares it to the analytical solution. The same result is obtained for all formulations.
label: ion_cyclotron_motion.mph
name: root

settings.description: Particle velocity, perpendicular to the magnetic field
settings.name: v0

settings.description: Subtract moving frame velocity from initial particle velocity
settings.name: SubtractMovingFrameVelocity

settings.name: StoreExtra

settings.description: Maximum number of wall interactions per time step
settings.name: MaxBounce

settings.description: Avoid inverted elements by curving interior domain elements
settings.name: curvedinterior

settings.name: useinitsol

settings.name: complexfun
